div.p: Greetings. I am brief so as not to double your trouble, dear brother.
For I know that Mr. Trechsel writes extensively on this matter, which I commend to you in every way.
I hear that Poland is ablaze with dissensions and abominable questions about the Trinity.
I see that Satan aims solely to make the preaching of the gospel infamous with blasphemous doctrines and to scatter the church with dissensions.
You are more experienced in this matter than others.
Therefore, help the brothers who are asking for your assistance.
I have enclosed the letters they sent to me with this.
I am entirely averse to these blasphemies and the disputes of these men.
There is much talk here about the peace made in France. I am indeed waiting for your letters or those of our friend Jonvill, from which I hope to learn the most certain and, hopefully, happy news.
The Muscovite, having entered Lithuania with a large army, has taken Płock by force and struck terror into the Poles, who are now said to be all in arms.
May the Lord keep you safe for us for a long time! May Mr. Jonvill be safe with Budé and the other brothers.
To the most illustrious man, Mr. Johannes Calvin, the most faithful pastor of the church of Geneva, my honorable lord and dearest brother.
